channel.title: UK VAT exchange rates API
channel.description:
Hi all,
A while back there was a [discussion about accepting multiple currencies](http://discuss.bootstrapped.fm/t/pricing-and-multiple-currencies/674). This is something that I've set up for DataTables sales as well, but, as @rachelandrew indicates in the earlier thread, you need extra information in order to be able to do UK VAT accounting correctly.
To that end I wrote an API for use internally - a backend service consumes the data published by HMRC and stores it in a database that the API can query. I use this for the majority of my invoices now, and I thought some other bootstrappers in the UK might be able to benefit from it.
Information about the API is [available in my blog](http://datatables.local/blog/2014-08-08) and [its own page](//api.datatables.net/vat), but in summary all you need to do is request the currency you want the published exchange rate for and it gives back a JSON object:
* [https://api.datatables.net/vat/exchange-rate/usd](https://api.datatables.net/vat/exchange-rate/usd) * [http://api.datatables.net/vat/exchange-rate/eur/2014-08-01](http://api.datatables.net/vat/exchange-rate/eur/2014-08-01) * etc
I hope one or more of you find it of some use!
Allan

item.title: UK VAT exchange rates API
item.dc:creator: lucaspiller
item.description:
The list of countries you used has some issues: Abu Dhabi and Dubai are listed as separate countries, but they are both part of the United Arab Emirates (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code AE).

Other than that, looks good!
